page.title: 11INTERVIEW-RNLI SECRETARY
page.content: The RNLI has been saving lives since 1824.Mr.Taylor's job is to look after spending and to make sure the whole station is in mint condition and ready to work at any time.He also makes sure that the station runs efficiently.Mr. Taylor's previous job was coxen at Cullercoats. The N8 pulling boat was dropped in 1937.There have also been sailing boats,power sailboats,modern power boats and many more.A while ago a lifeboatman just had to be sea bearing and know the area.Nowadays the men have to know about radars,first aid aswell as knowing about the area. Most lifeboatmen retire at 45 but if they wish to stay on they must pass a medical every year until they are 50 when they must retire.Lifeboatmen do a lot more jobs than they used to. Most types of rescues are pleasure
